FuncDef:
The backup hot-standby enable command enables hot standby (HSB) for an SRv6 TE Policy.
The undo backup hot-standby enable command deletes the preceding configuration.
The backup hot-standby disable command disables HSB for an SRv6 TE Policy.
The undo backup hot-standby disable command deletes the preceding configuration.
The undo backup hot-standby command deletes the HSB configuration of an SRv6 TE Policy and allows a device to inherit the configuration of the srv6-te-policy backup hot-standby enable command run in the Segment Routing IPv6 view.
By default, the configuration of the srv6-te-policy backup hot-standby enable command run in the Segment Routing IPv6 view is inherited directly.

ParaDef.Info:
Enables HSB for an SRv6 TE Policy.
-

Disables HSB for an SRv6 TE Policy. After you run the backup hot-standby disable command, HSB path information about the SRv6 TE Policy is deleted.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The srv6-te-policy backup hot-standby enable command enables HSB for all SRv6 TE Policies. However, the backup hot-standby command enables HSB for a single SRv6 TE Policy. If the srv6-te-policy backup hot-standby enable command and the backup hot-standby command are both run for an SRv6 TE Policy, the backup hot-standby command configuration takes precedence.
